title: Need your help Font-Detectives!
content:
I need to recreate a Logo without having the Original-File. Can you help me identify this attached font? I have tried Whatthefont, Linotype.Font-Identifier and Twitter. No results... Please help!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Bildschirmfoto 2009-11-12 um 11.06.56.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20091115190953/http:/typophile.com/files/Bildschirmfoto%202009-11-12%20um%2011.06.56.png) | 38.5 KB |
author: dworni

comments.content:
Looks abit like one of the house industries Chalet fonts, but customised maybe? If its a logo it may well be bespoke.  
Try Chalet Paris NineteenSeventy:  
 [http://www.houseind.com/fonts/chalet](http://web.archive.org/web/20091115190953/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/chalet "http://www.houseind.com/fonts/chalet")

Thank you Arran. Looks very similar true!  
Bu I think its a Freefont, it looks very cheap (also the rest of the designs from this firm). Hmm..

Visit our Mike for Bauhaus-like fonts:  
 [http://bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20091115190953/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces.html "http://bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces.html")

What about [Harry](http://web.archive.org/web/20091115190953/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/harry-pro/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D66%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3Dcablitec%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dot.liga%26seed%3D28)?  
Is that close enough?
